channel.title: [EasyRsc] Question
channel.description:
1 - How do I put a delay on the ::say command - So no one can spam in the global chat?
2 - How to I make global chat show up in quest history.

item.title: [EasyRsc] Question
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:16, topic:439591”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=542285.msg3979701#msg3979701 date=1335101965]

And you talk about respect. Funny yano, people bitch at people who can’t code and ask for things but when somebody actually doesn’t care comes along and gives people help and just gives them the code to what they need some arse comes along and flames them because there code is ugly.

Atleast i helped him and just gave him what he needed.

It is nice of you to try and help, but, in this case the help was written in such a way that it would be unhelpful in the long run.

I.e. if someone wanted give an item ten times and I told them to use this code.

int j = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < MAX_INTEGER_VALUE; i++) {
j++;
if (j < 10) {
giveItem();
}
}

How fucking awful. Just go back to RS2 sections already.
You have no right to judge anybodys code with your knowledge.

In case you don’t know, you don’t have to loop 2147m times just to give 10 items…

for(int i = 0;i < 10;i++)
	giveItem();

[/quote]

Did you even read what I said? I was giving an example of bad code… Seriously…

EDIT: Obviously I hit it spot on though, you really exploded :D[/quote]Your message was ‘tricky’, and could have easily been worded better.

I had to re-read it carefully to get the message you intended, but before that I thought you meant exactly what -Nothing thought.

Read full topic

EDIT: Obviously I hit it spot on though, you really exploded

item.title: [EasyRsc] Question
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:10, topic:439591”][quote author=freaky5000 link=topic=542285.msg3975997#msg3975997 date=1334664336]
And you talk about respect. Funny yano, people bitch at people who can’t code and ask for things but when somebody actually doesn’t care comes along and gives people help and just gives them the code to what they need some arse comes along and flames them because there code is ugly.

Atleast i helped him and just gave him what he needed.
[/quote]

It is nice of you to try and help, but, in this case the help was written in such a way that it would be unhelpful in the long run.

I.e. if someone wanted give an item ten times and I told them to use this code.

int j = 0; for (int i = 0; i < MAX_INTEGER_VALUE; i++) { j++; if (j < 10) { giveItem(); } } [/quote]
How fucking awful. Just go back to RS2 sections already.
You have no right to judge anybodys code with your knowledge.

In case you don’t know, you don’t have to loop 2147m times just to give 10 items…

for(int i = 0;i < 10;i++)
	giveItem();

item.title: [EasyRsc] Question
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“freaky5000, post:11, topic:439591”]I’ll explain the reason for it being so long

For another command which allows the say command to be turned off and on.

      if(!world.getGob() && !player.isPMod()) {
                                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@gre@Global chat is currently disabled.");
                        return;
                        }
                        boolean waittime = false;
                        if (lasttime == 0l) {
                                lasttime = System.currentTimeMillis();
                        }

For each rank

if (player.isAdmin()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@red@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                        } else if (player.isMod()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@blu@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                        } else if (player.isPMod()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                        } else if (player.isSubscriber()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@mag@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                } else if ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) > 6000 || lastplayer != player.getUsername()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                        } else {

Waiting period


          long timeremaining = 4 - ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) / 1000);
                                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need to wait " + timeremaining + " seconds before using ::say again.");
                                waittime = true;
                        }
                        Player pl;

Now if you can make that in to less code good for you, but I personally don’t see nothing wrong with it and it works a charm.[/quote]If you see nothing wrong with it, then you’re completely retarded.

Read full topic

      if(!world.getGob() && !player.isPMod()) {

                        }

For each rank

if (player.isAdmin()) {

                } else if ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) > 6000 || lastplayer != player.getUsername()) {
                                newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
                        } else {

Waiting period


          long timeremaining = 4 - ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) / 1000);
                                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need to wait " + timeremaining + " seconds before using ::say again.");

item.title: [EasyRsc] Question
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“freaky5000, post:9, topic:439591”]And you talk about respect. Funny yano, people bitch at people who can’t code and ask for things but when somebody actually doesn’t care comes along and gives people help and just gives them the code to what they need some arse comes along and flames them because there code is ugly.

Atleast i helped him and just gave him what he needed.[/quote]

It is nice of you to try and help, but, in this case the help was written in such a way that it would be unhelpful in the long run.

I.e. if someone wanted give an item ten times and I told them to use this code.

int j = 0;
for (int i = 0; i < MAX_INTEGER_VALUE; i++) {
j++;
if (j < 10) {
giveItem();
}
}

So in this case:

[code]if (cmd.equals(“say”)) {
if(!world.getGob() && !player.isPMod()) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@gre@Global chat is currently disabled.");
return;
}
boolean waittime = false;
if (lasttime == 0l) {
lasttime = System.currentTimeMillis();
}
ArrayList playersToSend = new ArrayList();
Player p;
for (Iterator i$ = world.getPlayers().iterator(); i$.hasNext(); playersToSend.add§) p = (Player) i$.next();
String newStr = “”;
for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append(newStr).append(args[i]).append(" “).toString();
}
if (newStr.contains(”~"))
newStr = newStr.replaceAll("~", “”);
if (player.isAdmin()) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@red@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
} else if (player.isMod()) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@blu@ “).append(player.getUsername()).append(”: @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
} else if (player.isPMod()) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@ “).append(player.getUsername()).append(”: @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
} else if (player.isSubscriber()) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@mag@ “).append(player.getUsername()).append(”: @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
} else if ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) > 6000 || lastplayer != player.getUsername()) {
newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
} else {
long timeremaining = 4 - ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) / 1000);
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You need to wait " + timeremaining + " seconds before using ::say again.”);
waittime = true;
}
Player pl;

                    if (!waittime) {
                            lasttime = System.currentTimeMillis();
                            lastplayer = player.getUsername();
                            for (Iterator i$ = playersToSend.iterator(); i$.hasNext(); pl.getActionSender().sendMessage(newStr)) {
                            pl = (Player) i$.next();
                            }
                    }
                    return;[/code]

That piece of code could be much nicer. I am not familiar with the systems this server is using, otherwise I would fix it for you as an example but I am sure you can agree that the code for doing something so simple should not be that long.

Read full topic

item.title: [EasyRsc] Question
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

if (cmd.equals("say")) {
			if(!world.getGob() && !player.isPMod()) {
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@gre@Global chat is currently disabled.");
			return;
			}
			boolean waittime = false;
			if (lasttime == 0l) {
				lasttime = System.currentTimeMillis();
			}
			ArrayList playersToSend = new ArrayList();
			Player p;
			for (Iterator i$ = world.getPlayers().iterator(); i$.hasNext(); playersToSend.add(p)) p = (Player) i$.next();
			String newStr = "";
			for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append(newStr).append(args[i]).append(" ").toString();
			}
			if (newStr.contains("~"))
				newStr = newStr.replaceAll("~", "");
			if (player.isAdmin()) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@red@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
			} else if (player.isMod()) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@blu@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
			} else if (player.isPMod()) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
			} else if (player.isSubscriber()) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@mag@ ").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
	        } else if ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) > 6000 || lastplayer != player.getUsername()) {
				newStr = (new StringBuilder()).append("@que@@gre@").append(player.getUsername()).append(": @whi@").append(newStr).toString();
			} else {
				long timeremaining = 4 - ((System.currentTimeMillis() - lasttime) / 1000);
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need to wait " + timeremaining + " seconds before using ::say again.");
				waittime = true;
			}
			Player pl;

			if (!waittime) {
				lasttime = System.currentTimeMillis();
				lastplayer = player.getUsername();
				for (Iterator i$ = playersToSend.iterator(); i$.hasNext(); pl.getActionSender().sendMessage(newStr)) {
				pl = (Player) i$.next();
				}
			}
			return;

You will need to remove the isSubscriber and also just below the “say” “if global chat is disabled”.

Read full topic

return;
}

player.lastSay = System.currentTimeMillis();[/code]

for the second question, @que@

If you still can’t figure it out, then you need to do more research about java.
